{{Other people|Mike Pearson}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} {{Use British English|date=February 2015}} {{Infobox person |name = Mike Parker Pearson |image = |image_size = |caption= |birth_name = Michael Parker Pearson |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1957|06|26|df=yes}} |birth_place = |death_place = |occupation = [[Archaeologist]] |known_for = [[Stonehenge Riverside Project]] | nationality = British | other_names = Michael Parker Pearson | alma_mater = [[University of Southampton]]
[[King's College, Cambridge]] }} '''Michael 'Mike' Parker Pearson''', [[Fellow of the Society of Antiquaries of London|FSA]], [[Fellow of the Society of Antiquaries of Scotland|FSA Scot]], [[Fellow of the British Academy|FBA]] (born 26 June 1957)[http://www.ukwhoswho.com/view/article/oupww/whoswho/U258069 PARKER PEARSON, Prof. Michael George], ''Who's Who 2014'', A & C Black, 2014; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 is an English [[archaeology|archaeologist]] specialising in the study of the [[Neolithic British Isles]], [[Madagascar]] and the archaeology of death and burial, and is known for his catchphrase "The Dead Don't Bury Themselves". A professor at the [[UCL Institute of Archaeology]], he previously worked for 25 years as a professor at the [[University of Sheffield]] in England, and was the director of the [[Stonehenge Riverside Project]].{{cite web | url= http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/archaeology/people/parker | publisher= [[University of Sheffield]] | title= Professor Michael Parker Pearson | work= Department of Archaeology | accessdate= 22 December 2011 }}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} A prolific author, he has also written a variety of books on the subject. Parker Pearson gained his BA in archaeology from [[Southampton University]] in 1979. Supervised by [[Ian Hodder]] as a post-graduate at Cambridge, Parker Pearson was a contemporary of Sheena Crawford, [[Daniel Miller (anthropologist)|Daniel Miller]], [[Henrietta Moore]], [[Christopher Tilley]] and Alice Welbourn; these students were influenced by Hodder's ideas, then a pioneering part of the [[Post-processual archaeology|post-processualist]] current within [[archaeological theory]]. He went on to gain his PhD at the [[University of Cambridge]] in 1985, producing a thesis on burials and [[bog bodies]] in Iron Age Denmark. A media personality, Parker Pearson has appeared several times in the Channel 4 show ''[[Time Team]]'' in particular in one looking at the excavation of [[Durrington Walls]]. He also appeared in the National Geographic Channel documentary ''Stonehenge Decoded'', along with the PBS programme "[[Nova (TV series)|NOVA]]: Secrets of Stonehenge".{{cite web | url = http://www.studenthandouts.com/01-Web-Pages/Books-Films/Reviews/2010-pbs-nova-secrets-of-stonehenge-video-review-guide.htm | title= 'Secrets of Stonehenge' from PBS's Nova Television Series (2010) | accessdate= 2 July 2012}} ==Early life and education== Parker Pearson was born in 1957.{{cite web | url = http://www.worldcat.org/identities/lccn-n93-14798 | title= Parker Pearson, Michael 1957– | publisher= OCLC Online Computer Library Center, Inc. | work= WorldCat Identities | accessdate= 22 December 2011}} He would later inform interviewers that he first took an interest in the past when searching for [[fossils]] in his father's driveway gravel aged 4, extending that interest into the human past aged 6 when he read a library book entitled ''Fun with Archaeology''.[[#Par10|Yewtree and Parker Pearson 2010]]. Deciding to study the subject at the undergraduate level, he attended the [[University of Southampton]], attaining a first class BA with honours in Archaeology in 1979.[[#UCL|UCL 2012]]. Parker Pearson became interested in [[Marxism]]. In the 1984 anthology ''Ideology, Power and Prehistory'', edited by Daniel Miller and Christopher Tilley, Parker Pearson published a paper in which he examined the pre-state societies of Jutland from a Marxist perspective. At the start of this paper, he noted that it had repurcussions for Marxism in that its findings discerned "a certain blurring between capitalism and non-capitalism."[[#Par84|Parker Pearson 1984]]. p. 69. He obtained his PhD from [[King's College, Cambridge|King's College]], [[University of Cambridge]] in 1985, for a thesis which he had titled "Death, society and social change: the Iron Age of southern Jutland 200 BC – 600 AD" in which he discussed what was known about the [[bog bodies]] of Denmark; it would remain unpublished.[[#Par99|Parker Pearson 1999]]. p. 234. ==Early career== From 1984 through to 1990, Parker Pearson worked as an Inspector of Monuments for [[English Heritage]], and in 1989 he received membership to the [[Institute for Archaeologists]]. In 1990, he secured an academic teaching position at the Department of Archaeology at the [[University of Sheffield]], where he would work for the next 21 years. In 1991 he was admitted as a Fellow of the [[Society of Antiquaries of London]], and in 1996 then became a Fellow of the [[Society of Antiquaries of Scotland]]. ==Stonehenge Riverside Project and UCL== From 2003 through to 2009, Parker Pearson directed the [[Stonehenge Riverside Project]]. The project garnered three major archaeological awards: the Andante Travel Archaeology Award (2008), the Royal Society of Northern Antiquaries Award (2009), and the UK Archaeological Research Project of the Year (2010). His work in leading the project also led to Parker Pearson being personally awarded the UK Archaeologist of the Year award in 2010. Parker Pearson and his team of researchers played a key role in the discovery of a new henge site along the [[River Avon, Hampshire|River Avon]] that links to [[Stonehenge]]. This new site was uncovered through excavation during the Stonehenge Riverside Project and was given the name "[[Bluestonehenge]]" or "Bluehenge" because traces of [[bluestones]] were found during the [[excavation (archaeology)|excavation]]. From 2006 through to 2009, he served as the Vice-President of the [[Prehistoric Society]]. Interacting with various parts of the media, Parker Pearson has published articles in a variety of different sources, such as on the [[BBC]] website,[[#Par11|Parker Pearson 2011]], has given interviews to groups such as Pagans for Archaeology and most recently discussed his career in an interview with [[Papers from the Institute of Archaeology]].Williams and Koriech 2012 In 2012, Parker Pearson left the University of Sheffield and began teaching at the [[UCL Institute of Archaeology|Institute of Archaeology]], [[University College London]], as Professor of British Later Prehistory. On 16 July 2015, he was elected a [[Fellow of the British Academy]] (FBA).{{cite web|title=British Academy Fellowship reaches 1,000 as 42 new UK Fellows are welcomed|url=http://www.britac.ac.uk/news/news.cfm/newsid/1292|website=British Academy|accessdate=17 July 2015|date=16 July 2015}} ==Bibliography== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |+ |- ! scope="col" | Title ! scope="col" | Year ! scope="col" | Co-author(s) ! scope="col" | Publisher ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | ISBN |- ! scope="row" | '' '' | | | | |- ! scope="row" | ''Bronze Age Britain'' | 1993 | ''n/a'' | English Heritage and B.T. '''Muhammad ibn Qasim''' was an [[Alid]] [[Imam]].
==Background== Qasim led an Alid rebellion that took place in [[Taloqan]] at the beginning of the 3rd century of Hijrah (A.H.), in the year 219 A.H (834 C.E.), during the days of the [[Abbasid]][[Caliphate]] of [[Al-Mu'tasim]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mapsofindia.com/history/battles/arab-invasion-of-sind-under-mohammed-bin-qasim.html|title=The Arab Invasion of Sind under Mohammed-bin-Qasim|website=www.mapsofindia.com|accessdate=1 October 2018}}</ref>
==Capture and escape== However, Al-Mu'tasim defeated and arrested him and carried him to [[Baghdad]], detaining him in his palace. Shortly after, Muhammad was able to run away and flee, and was never heard of again.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.ca/books?id=h9yluZH7dGIC&pg=PT12&lpg=PT12&sig=aF9wVQbVQ_watFBOVbRFpMufL5c&ved=0ahUKEwiLw97gwNTZAhUNwGMKHUAJDwYQ6AEIUTAH#v=onepage&q=Muhammad%20ibn%20Qasim%20was%20never%20heard%20from%20again|title=Raptor Force: Holy Fire|last=Yenne|first=Bill|date=2007-02-06|publisher=Penguin|isbn=9781440622809|language=en}}</ref>
==Aftermath== Due to the unknown nature of his disappearance, people differed about his affair. Some people believed he died or fled, while some of the [[Shia|Shiites]] believed he was alive and would reappear and that he was the [[Mahdi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.indiatvnews.com/news/india/know-how-the-first-muslim-invader-muhammad-bin-qasim-died-45667.html|title=Know how the first Muslim invader Muhammad bin Qasim died after killing Raja Dahir|date=29 December 2014|publisher=|accessdate=1 October 2018}}</ref>
==See also== *[[List of people who disappeared]]

{{Infobox person | image = Nahum Benari portrait.jpg | alt = Picture of Nahum Benari, 1950 | caption = Nahum Benari, 1950 | birth_name = Nahum Brodski | birth_date = {{Birth date|1893|01|03}} | birth_place = [[Lebedyn]], [[Ukraine]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1963|12|24|1893|01|03}} <!-- (death date then birth date) --> | death_place = [[Israel]] | resting_place = [[Ein Harod (Meuhad)|Ein Harod Meuchad]], Israel [http://www.pikholz.org/Cemetery/NBenari_EHarodM.html tombstone picture] | nationality = | known_for = promoting many Israeli cultural initiatives in the 1940s-50s | occupation = }} '''Nahum Benari''' ({{lang-he-n|נַחוּם בֶּנאֲרִי}}) (January 3, 1893 – December 24, 1963) was an Israeli writer and an intellectual. He is known mainly for promoting many Israeli cultural initiatives, primarily in the 1940s-50s, through his position as a member of the management body of the [[Histadrut]] (abbreviation for lit. The General Federation of Laborers in the Land of Israel).
Benari was a prolific writer, who wrote on several subjects in various genres: treatises, pamphlets, plays, and more; about [[kibbutz]] and [[Zionism|Zionist]] ideals and practices; about the making of ceremonies and festivals for Sabbath, holidays, and memorial days; about philosophy; and about stories and thoughts aroused by the day to day reality of the [[yishuv]] and Israel in its first years. Moreover, he translated books of other authors and edited books and journals.<ref>Benari's knowledge of Hebrew grammar and vowelization rules brought poets to consult him on those matters.</ref> He was a man of creative imagination who could translate ideas and thoughts about culture and education into actions.<ref>''איש הדמיון היוצר'', רשימה לזכרו של בנארי, מאת א. תרשיש — עיתון ''למרחב'', January 1, 1964 page 2</ref>
== Biography == === Early life in Ukraine === Benari was born Nahum Brodski in 1893, in the Jewish part of the town of [[Lebedyn]] in [[Ukraine]], then part of the [[Russian Empire]]. His father, Arie Leib, held a senior position at a sugar factory, and his mother, Devora, was a housewife; he was their firstborn of ten children. As an adolescent he was sent to learn in a [[yeshiva]] (a religious school), but the studies of [[Halakha]] (religious laws) didn't satisfy his curiosity. He moved from yeshiva to yeshiva across Ukraine until he arrived at [[Odessa]], where he attended the yeshiva of Rabbi Chaim Tchernowitz (Rav Tza'ir)<ref>[https://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/judaica/ejud_0002_0019_0_19663.html Rabbi Chaim Tchernowitz (Rav Tza'ir)] in the Jewish Virtual Library</ref> and graduated in 1911. Among his teachers in this yeshiva were well-known authors such as [[Hayim Nahman Bialik]] and [[Mendele Mocher Sforim]], and there he absorbed [[Zionism|Zionist]] values, which he passed on to his brothers and sisters.<ref>חוברת '''רשימות''', מרדכי בנארי, הוצאת קיבוץ יגור, page 19.</ref>
=== First years in the Land of Israel === In May 1914, a few months before the beginning of the [[World War I|First World War]], Benari arrived in the [[Land of Israel]], then part of the [[Ottoman Empire]]. During the first years after making [[Aliyah]], he hired himself out as a farm worker, first at [[Degania Alef|Degania]] and then at [[Ilaniya]]. In those years he became acquainted with immigrants of the [[Second Aliyah]] and [[Third Aliyah]]. He wrote the article "HaKabtzanim HaSmechim" (lit. The Happy Beggars) about this period.<ref>ספר '''העלייה השנייה''' וספר '''כאן על פני האדמה''', page 93.</ref> During this period he also met his first wife, Sonia Dubnov, with whom he had three children.
After the First World War, at the time of the [[Mandatory Palestine|British Mandate for Palestine]], he moved with his family to wherever he could find a job: he planted trees on [[Mount Carmel]], served as a court clerk in [[Tel Aviv]], and took on some temporary jobs in [[Jerusalem]]. While working as a court clerk he wrote the article "Inyanei Beit Din" (lit. court matters). During this period his brothers and sisters made Aliyah along with their mother; most of them settled in the rural Israeli settlements called Kibbutzim (plural of [[Kibbutz]]).<ref>חוברת '''בנארים''' לתולדות המשפחה, עין-חרוד, October 2007.</ref> In October 1922, after hearing of his father's death, he changed his surname to Benari (Hebrew: בֶּנאֲרִי, lit. lion's son); his brothers and sisters followed him in this act.<ref>''סבתא'' רשימה מאת [[גרשון שופמן]], '''כתבים''' Vol. 3, page 219.</ref>
=== Living at Ein Harod === At the beginning of 1925, Benari and his family joined a kibbutz named [[Ein Harod]]. He worked in the fields and in the vineyard. At Ein Harod he was among those who conceived the Kibbutz's way of celebrating Jewish holidays. A main theme in the newly designed festivals and ceremonies was the agricultural year circle. For example, at [[Passover]] they established a ceremony for the beginning of the harvest, and at [[Shavuot]] a secular celebration of [[Bikkurim (Talmud)|Bikkurim]] (Hebrew: ביכורים, lit. first fruits). Benari also edited the periodical MiBifnim (Hebrew: [[:he:מבפנים|מבפנים]], lit. from the inside). The periodical of the kibbutzim organization [[HaKibbutz HaMeuchad]] (lit. the unified kibbutz or [[Kibbutz Movement|united kibbutz]]), stemmed from Ein Harod's journal. Benari lived in Ein Harod until 1942, and there he met his second wife, Yehudit Mensch, with whom he had one son.
=== Hechalutz activity === Benari was sent abroad on [[Hechalutz]] missions three times. In the years 1927-1929 he was sent by Ein Harod's leadership to Hechalutz center in [[Warsaw]], [[Poland]]. During those two years, he lectured to and talked with young Jews in towns and Chavot [[Hakhshara|Hachshara]] (lit. training farms), in Poland, [[Germany]], [[Lithuania]], and [[Czech Republic|The Czech Republic]]. Additionally, he edited Hechalutz's journal called HeAtid (Hebrew: העתיד, lit. The Future). Between 1934-1936 he was sent for the second time by Ein Harod's leadership to the Hechalutz center in Warsaw, this time he also acted as a delegate to the 19th [[World Zionist Congress|Zionist Congress]] at [[Lucerne]], [[Switzerland]]. In the latter part of [[World War II|the Second World War]], from October 1944 to January 1945, he went on his third mission. This time he was sent with two other men by [[Solel Boneh]], a construction company, to join its work teams in the oil refineries in [[Abadan, Iran|Abadan]], [[Iran]]. Benari went as a social consultant, but he actually operated undercover as a Hechalutz emissary to encourage Zionist activity among the Jewish communities in Iran, [[Iraq]], and [[Syria]].<ref>''נשאר באזור'', רשימה מאת [[חיים באר]], גיליון '''דבר השבוע''' March 29, 1991, page 14.</ref>
Alongside performing missions abroad, Benari was also a pamphleteer of Hechalutz and the Zionist ideology.
== Associations for Culture and Education == At the beginning of 1942, Benari left Ein Harod with his family in order to focus on his cultural and educational activities. First he worked for Solel Boneh, but it wasn't long before he joined The Center of Culture and Education of the Histadrut. He was among the founders of Associations for Culture and Education (Hebrew: מפעלי תרבות וחינוך) and ran it for nearly twenty years. In this office he promoted many cultural initiatives by supplying funds and an organizational roof. Among the most eminent associations that were raised under his service were: #'''[http://www.omanut-laam.co.il/english/home.asp Omanut Laam Association]''' (Hebrew: אמנות לעם, lit. culture for the people) - An association, founded as Telem, which connected established theaters with peripheral and rural settlements and workers' committees. #'''Cinema Department''' - A department that distributed selected movies, in [[16 mm film]], to all periphery communities and military camps, thus enabling movie screening everywhere. #'''Artists and intellectuals meetings with workmen''' - Arranging meetings between all kinds of artists (such as authors, poets, painters, and sculptors) or thinkers and the workmen of different places such as industrial plants, agriculture based communities (kibbutz and [[moshav]]), immigrant camps ([[Ma'abarot]]), and military camps. #'''Israeli Institute for Education by Correspondence''' (Hebrew name (acronym): Mishlav) - An institute that preceded the foundation of the [[Open University of Israel]]. #'''Sifri''' (Hebrew: ספרי, lit. my book) - A publishing house and a book store. #'''Folk dancing class''' - This class gave a stage to choreographers of folk dances who used the folk music of the time. This class established the foundations for widening folk dancing activity in Israel, an activity existing to this day.
Alongside enabling the formation of new cultural establishments, the Associations for Culture and Education, under Benari management, also supported existing foundations such as HaOhel Theater (Hebrew: האהל, lit. The Tent), The Israeli Opera, [[Inbal Dance Theater]], and [[Am Oved]] publishing house.

{{Infobox person | name = Norikazu Otsuka(S-28) | native_name = 大塚 範一 | native_name_lang = ja | image = <!-- just the name, without the File: or Image: prefix or enclosing [[brackets]] --> | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1948|09|28|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Tokyo]], Japan | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|1948|09|28|df=y}} (death date then birth date) --> | death_place = | death_cause = | residence = | nationality = Japanese | other_names = | education = | alma_mater = [[Waseda University]] | occupation = TV presenter | years_active = 1973 – 2013 | employer = [[Fuji TV]] | organization = | height = <!-- {{height|m=}} --> | television = ''[[Mezamashi TV]]'' | spouse = | partner = <!-- unmarried life partner; use ''Name (1950–present)'' --> | children = | website = <!-- {{URL|Example.com}} --> }} {{Nihongo|'''Norikazu Otsuka'''|大塚 範一|Ōtsuka Norikazu|born 28 September 1948}} is a Japanese TV presenter. He was the main presenter of [[Fuji TV]]'s morning TV magazine show ''[[Mezamashi TV]]'' from its start in 1994 until he left the show November 2011 due to illness.<ref name="tokyograph20111106"/>
==Early life and education== Otsuka was born in Tokyo on 28 September 1948.<ref name="waseda20091105">{{cite web |url=http://www.waseda.jp/student/weekly/contents/2009b/1200/200d.html|title= OG・OBインタビュー フリーアナウンサー 大塚 範一さん|trans-title=Alumnus Interview: Freelance presenter Norikazu Otsuka|date= 5 November 2009|work= Waseda Weekly|publisher= Student Affairs Division, Waseda University|location= Japan|language= Japanese|archiveurl= |archivedate= |accessdate= 10 January 2014}}</ref>
In 1973, he graduated from [[Waseda University]], Department of Political Science and Economics.<ref name="waseda20091105"/>
==Career== Immediately after graduating from university in 1973, Otsuka started work at [[NHK]], working at various regional offices, including [[Takamatsu, Kagawa|Takamatsu]], [[Hiroshima]], and [[Nagoya]], over a period of eleven years before being transferred to Tokyo.<ref name="waseda20091105"/> There, he presented TV programmes such as {{Nihongo|''Sunday Sports Special''|サンデースポーツスペシャル}} and {{Nihongo|''Quiz 100 points Full Marks''|クイズ百点満点}}, as well as working as a commentator for baseball, football, and tennis broadcasts.<ref name="waseda20091105"/>
He left NHK in March 1994, and began presenting [[Fuji TV]]'s ''[[Mezamashi TV]]'' morning show from April 1994.<ref name="waseda20091105"/>
Otsuka took a break from presenting ''Mezamashi TV'' in November 2011 to undergo treatment for [[acute lymphoblastic leukemia]].<ref name="tokyograph20111106">{{cite web |url= http://www.tokyograph.com/news/announcer-otsuka-norikazu-diagnosed-with-leukemia|title= Announcer Otsuka Norikazu diagnosed with leukemia|date= 6 November 2011|work= Tokyograph|archiveurl= |archivedate= |accessdate= 10 January 2014}}</ref> In February 2012, it was announced that Otsuka would be formally leaving the programme as of April 2012.<ref name="nikkan20120228">{{cite web |url= http://www.nikkansports.com/entertainment/news/f-et-tp0-20120228-910087.html|script-title=ja:闘病中の大塚キャスター「めざまし」卒業|trans-title=Otsuka to leave "Mezamashi TV" due to illness|date= 28 February 2012|work= Nikkan Sports|publisher= Nikkan Sports News|location= Japan|language= Japanese|archiveurl= |archivedate= |accessdate= 10 January 2014}}</ref> He was released from hospital in October 2012, and made a live appearance on ''Mezamashii TV'' on 4 February 2013, after 15 months away from the screen.<ref name="dailysports20130204">{{cite web |url= http://daily.co.jp/gossip/illness/2013/02/04/0005719793.shtml|script-title=ja:大塚キャスター４６１日ぶり生出演|trans-title=Otsuka makes live appearance for first time in 461 days|date= 4 February 2013|work= Daily Sports Online|publisher= Daily Sports|location= Japan|language= Japanese|archiveurl= |archivedate= |accessdate= 10 January 2014}}</ref> During this appearance, Otsuka revealed that he would be returning to work at Fuji TV, presenting a new afternoon magazine show, {{Nihongo|''Ageru TV''|アゲるテレビ|}}, from April 2013.<ref name="dailysports20130204"/> However, in March of the same year, it was revealed that Otsuka's leukemia had relapsed, and that he would not be presenting the show.<ref name="dailysports20130316">{{cite web |url= http://www.daily.co.jp/newsflash/gossip/2013/03/16/0005818584.shtml|script-title=ja:大塚範一キャスター、白血病を再発|trans-title=Otsuka suffers a relapse of leukemia|date= 16 March 2013|work= Daily Sports Online|publisher= Daily Sports|location= Japan|language= Japanese|archiveurl= |archivedate= |accessdate= 10 January 2014}}</ref> The show was terminated at the end of September 2013, after just six months on the air.<ref name="nikkansports20130316">{{cite web |url= http://www.nikkansports.com/entertainment/news/f-et-tp0-20130730-1165119.html|script-title=ja:フジ系「アゲるテレビ」９月打ち切り|trans-title=Fuji TV to cancel "Ageru TV" in September|date= 30 July 2013|work= Nikkan Sports|publisher= Nikkan Sports News|location= Japan|language= Japanese|archiveurl= |archivedate= |accessdate= 10 January 2014}}</ref>

portal|publisher=[[Verkhovna Rada|Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine]]|accessdate=22 December 2014|language=Ukrainian}} | term_start13 = November 27, 2014 | term_end13 = }} '''Oleksandr Valentynovych Turchynov''' ({{lang-uk|Олександр Валентинович Турчинов}}; born 31 March 1964) is a [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] politician, screenwriter, [[Baptist]] minister and economist. He is the current Secretary of the [[National Security and Defence Council of Ukraine]]. Turchynov is a former [[Acting (law)|acting]] [[President of Ukraine]] from the [[2014 Ukrainian revolution|removal from power of President]] [[Viktor Yanukovych]] on 21 February 2014,{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-26312008|title=Ukraine: Speaker Oleksandr Turchynov named interim president|work=[[BBC News]]|date=23 February 2014|accessdate=26 February 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140223115150/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-26312008|archivedate=23 February 2014|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-26248275|title=Ukraine protests timeline|publisher=BBC News|date=23 February 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-26248275|archivedate=1 December 2008|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=http://voiceofrussia.com/news/2014_02_22/Alexander-Turchinov-elected-as-spiker-of-Ukrainian-Parliament-5922/|title=Turchinov elected as speaker of Ukrainian Parliament|publisher=[[Voice of Russia]]|date=22 February 2014|accessdate=22 February 2014|archivedate=23 February 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140223052109/http://voiceofrussia.com/news/2014_02_22/Alexander-Turchinov-elected-as-spiker-of-Ukrainian-Parliament-5922/|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|date=26 February 2014|accessdate=26 February 2014|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/192848.html|title=Turchynov assumes duties of supreme commander-in-chief of Ukrainian Armed Forces|agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]]|archivedate=15 April 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140415022832/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/192848.html|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}} until [[Petro Poroshenko]] was sworn in as Ukrainian President on 7 June 2014. He then became [[Chairman of the Verkhovna Rada|Chairman of the Ukrainian Parliament]] until 27 November 2014. Turchynov also served as acting [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]] in 2010 (when he was the First Vice Prime Minister in the absence of a prime minister after [[Yulia Tymoshenko]]'s [[Second Tymoshenko Government|government]] was dismissed on 3 March 2010{{cite news|date=4 March 2010|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/60998/|title=Press secretary: Tymoshenko vacates premier's post|newspaper=Kyiv Post|accessdate=16 February 2014|agency=Interfax-Ukraine|archivedate=7 March 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100307140238/http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/60998/|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}) until the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian parliament) appointed [[Mykola Azarov]] as Prime Minister on 11 March 2010.{{cite news|title=Ukrainian President Viktor Yanukovych forms coalition|publisher=BBC News|date=11 March 2010|accessdate=16 February 2014|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/8561531.stm|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100312052933/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/8561531.stm|archivedate=12 March 2010|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|agency=UNIAN|date=11 March 2010|url=http://unian.net/eng/news/news-366879.html|title=Azarov became Prime Minister|accessdate=16 February 2014|archivedate=14 March 2010|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100314085313/http://www.unian.net/eng/news/news-366879.html|df=dmy-all}} In 2005, Turchynov served as the head of the [[Security Service of Ukraine]]. Turchynov was the first deputy chairman of the political party [[Batkivshchyna]] (All-Ukrainian Union "Fatherland") and a close associate of party leader [[Yulia Tymoshenko]].{{cite news|url=http://www.unian.info/politics/403088-turchynov-is-summoned-for-interrogation-to-sbu-today-byut.html|title=Turchynov is summoned for interrogation to SBU today – BYUT|agency=[[Ukrainian Independent Information Agency|UNIAN]]|date=20 September 2010|accessdate=7 October 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140227045553/http://www.unian.info/politics/403088-turchynov-is-summoned-for-interrogation-to-sbu-today-byut.html|archivedate=27 February 2014|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|accessdate=14 June 2013|date=14 June 2013|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/content/politics/batkivschyna-to-nominate-tymoshenko-for-presidency-yatseniuk-heads-partys-political-council-325666.html|title=Batkivschyna to nominate Tymoshenko for presidency, Yatseniuk heads party's political council|publisher=[[Kyiv Post]]|agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]]|archivedate=15 June 2013|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130615114353/http://www.kyivpost.com/content/politics/batkivschyna-to-nominate-tymoshenko-for-presidency-yatseniuk-heads-partys-political-council-325666.html|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/118331/|title=BYT-Batkivschyna replaces its leader|newspaper=Kyiv Post|agency=Interfax-Ukraine|date=7 December 2011|accessdate=14 December 2011|archivedate=7 December 2011|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111207124431/http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/118331/|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}} He started the new political party [[People's Front (Ukraine)|People's Front]] in September 2014, now together with Prime Minister [[Arseniy Yatsenyuk]]. ==Biography== Oleksandr Turchynov was born in [[Dnipropetrovsk]]. He graduated from the [[Dnipropetrovsk Metallurgical Institute]] in 1986, after which he worked at [[Kryvorizhstal]], a large Ukrainian steel producer. From 1987 to 1990, he served as head of the agitation and propaganda division of the Dnipropetrovsk Oblast [[Komsomol|Komsomol (Communist Youth League)]] Committee, which was led by [[Serhiy Tihipko]]. Tihipko and Turchynov became political advisers of [[Leonid Kuchma]], then head of Dnipropetrovsk-based [[Yuzhmash|Pivdenmash]] missile manufacturer. Kuchma and his entire team, including Tihipko and Turchynov moved to Kiev in 1992, after Kuchma was appointed [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]]. In 1993 Turchynov was formally appointed an advisor on economic issues to Prime Minister Kuchma. Turchynov is an old ally of [[Yulia Tymoshenko]], another prominent Ukrainian political figure from Dnipropetrovsk. They used to have a common business in Dnipropetrovsk. In December 1993, Turchynov co-founded and became Vice President of Ukrainian Union of Industrialist and Entrepreneurs. In 1994 he created the political party [[Hromada (political party)|Hromada]] together with [[Pavlo Lazarenko]], a business ally of Tymoshenko. Turchynov was also director of the Economic Reforms Institute from January 1994 to March 1998 and was head of the Ukrainian National Academy of Sciences' Laboratory of [[Shadow Economy]] Research.[http://www.ibyut.com/members.html Bloc Yulia Tymoshenko members biography's, Bloc Yulia Tymoshenko official website] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080126231934/http://www.ibyut.com/members.html |date=26 January 2008 }}{{cite news|title=Who Is Who in Tymoshenko's Government?|url=http://www2.pravda.com.ua/en/news/2007/12/23/9641.htm|date=23 December 2007|accessdate=23 February 2014|newspaper=[[Ukrayinska Pravda]]|archivedate=13 March 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080313173732/http://www2.pravda.com.ua/en/news/2007/12/23/9641.htm|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} ==Political life== [[File:Yatsenyuk and Tyahnybok.jpg|thumb|left|Turchynov, [[Arseniy Yatsenyuk]] and [[Oleh Tyahnybok]] with coalition agreement before [[2012 Ukrainian parliamentary election]].]] [[File:Tyahnybok Turchynov 24-02-14.jpg|thumb|left|Turchynov and [[Oleh Tyahnybok]] in parliament, 24 February 2014]] In [[Ukrainian parliamentary election, 1998|1998, he was elected]] to [[Verkhovna Rada|parliament]] as a member of [[Hromada (political party)|Hromada]] but after the [[Pavlo Lazarenko#Imprisonments and trials|scandal around Lazarenko]], he left the faction and party (during May 1999) together with Yulia Tymoshenko's [[All-Ukrainian Union "Fatherland"]]. He was re-elected to parliament in 2002 and 2006 as part of the [[BYuT]]. On 4 February 2005, Turchynov was appointed and served as the first‐ever civilian head of the [[Security Service of Ukraine]] (SBU). With the approval of Turchynov as the head of the SBU, he dissolved the investigation team that was investigating the [[Georgiy Gongadze]] case since 2002. According to the first deputy head of the Main Investigation Department of the [[Prosecutor General of Ukraine|Prosecutor General's Office of Ukraine]] Roman Shubin, Turchynov ordered not to provide operational data on the Gongadze case to the investigation group of the Security Service of Ukraine.{{cite web |url=http://podrobnosti.ua/308083-genprokuratura-ljudi-turchinova-dezinformirujut-obschestvennost.html |title=Генпрокуратура: Люди Турчинова дезинформируют общественность |publisher=podrobnosti.ua |language=ru |date=25 April 2006 |accessdate=21 March 2018}}{{cite web |title=Дело Гонгадзе: Пукач скрывается в Украине? |url=http://www.segodnya.ua/ukraine/delo-honhadze-pukach-ckryvaetcja-v-ukraine.html |work=[[Segodnya]] |language=ru |date=16 November 2007 |accessdate=21 March 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://zn.ua/LAW/avantyury_diletantov.html |title=Авантюры дилетантов |work=[[Dzerkalo Tyzhnia]] |language=ru |date=28 April 2006 |accessdate=21 March 2018}} In August 2007, Turchynov replied to the accusation that his stance on [[same-sex marriage]] is typically conservative, "I do not agree. If a man has normal views, then you label him a conservative, but those who use drugs or promote [[sodomy]], you label them a progressive person. All of these are [[perversions]]".{{cite web|url=http://www.lgf.org.uk/news/research-2/overview-of-lesbian-and-gay-rights-in-eastern-europe/|title=Overview of Lesbian and Gay rights in Eastern Europe|publisher=[[The Lesbian & Gay Foundation]]|accessdate=12 August 2009|archivedate=20 August 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080820220202/http://www.lgf.org.uk/news/research-2/overview-of-lesbian-and-gay-rights-in-eastern-europe/|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} In the spring of 2008, he was the [[Yulia Tymoshenko Bloc]] and the [[Our Ukraine–People's Self-Defense Bloc]] candidate{{cite web|url=http://korrespondent.net/kyiv/471273|script-title=ru:Тимошенко и Луценко объявили Турчинова единым кандидатом от коалиции|trans-title=Tymoshenko and Lutsenko announced Turchynov the only candidate from the coalition|accessdate=19 June 2008|date=22 May 2008|work=[[Korrespondent.net]]|language=ru|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081122073438/http://korrespondent.net/kyiv/471273|archivedate=22 November 2008|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}} for the [[Kiev local election, 2008|Mayor of Kiev election]] he placed second at the election with 218,600 votes (19.13% of total vote).{{cite news|url=http://www.unian.net/eng/ |title=UNIAN News Agency 2009|deadurl=no|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/54426/|title=Western Information Agency: Yushchenko and Yanukovych are playing ball|newspaper=[[Kyiv Post]]|archivedate=28 January 2011|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110128111547/http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/54426/|df=dmy-all}} From December 2009 till March 2010, the adviser to Turchynov in the after the fall of the second Tymoshenko Government, former Prime Minister [[Yulia Tymoshenko]] resigned from that post on 4 March 2010 and Turchynov was empowered to fulfill the Prime Minister's Prime Minister the same day. According to [[WikiLeaks]], the Prosecutor General of Ukraine [[Oleksandr Medvedko]] ordered former [[Ministry of Internal Affairs (Ukraine)|Minister of Internal Affairs]] [[Yuriy Lutsenko]] to arrest Yulia Tymoshenko's teammates – Oleksandr Turchynov and [[Andriy Kozhemiakin]] – for destroying the documents of the [[Security Service of Ukraine]] in which the connection between Tymoshenko and the criminal businessman [[Semion Mogilevich]] was proved.{{Cite web |url=https://www.segodnya.ua/politics/wikileaks-turchinov-unichtozhil-kompromat-cbu-na-timoshenko.html |title=Wikileaks: Турчинов уничтожил компромат СБУ на Тимошенко |work=[[Segodnya]] |language=ru |date=29 November 2010 |accessdate=11 April 2018}}{{Cite web |url=https://ria.ru/world/20140612/1011715160.html |title=WikiLeaks: Тимошенко могла сотрудничать с криминальным миром |publisher=[[RIA Novosti]] |language=ru |date=12 June 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2018}}{{Cite web |url=https://actualidad.rt.com/actualidad/view/130878-wikileaks-poroshenko-informando-eeuu |title=WikiLeaks: «Poroshenko estuvo informando a la embajada EE.UU. en 2006» |publisher=[[RT en Español]]|language=es |date=12 June 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2018}} In [[Ukrainian parliamentary election, 2012|2012 he was re-elected]] into parliament on the party list of [[All-Ukrainian Union "Fatherland"|"Fatherland"]].{{cite news|url=http://www.pravda.com.ua/articles/2012/11/11/6977259/|script-title=uk:Список депутатів нової Верховної Ради|trans-title=List of Parliament Members of the new Verkhovna Rada|place=[[Ukraine|UA]]|newspaper=[[Ukrayinska Pravda]]|date=11 November 2012|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121113192113/http://www.pravda.com.ua/articles/2012/11/11/6977259/|archivedate=13 November 2012|accessdate=9 January 2013|deadurl=no|language=uk|df=dmy-all}} On 22 February 2014, he was elected as speaker of [[Verkhovna Rada]]. On 23 February 2014, Turchynov was designated as acting [[President of Ukraine]] following the [[2014 Ukrainian revolution|impeachment]] of [[Viktor Yanukovych]].{{cite web|agency=[[Sofia News Agency]]|url=http://www.novinite.com/articles/158429/Ukraine's+Parliament+to+Appoint+Opposition+Leader+Acting+PM|title=Ukraine's Parliament Appoints Opposition Leader Acting PM|work=Novinite|accessdate=22 February 2014|archivedate=23 February 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140223051846/http://www.novinite.com/articles/158429/Ukraine's+Parliament+to+Appoint+Opposition+Leader+Acting+PM|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}} On 25 February Turchynov assumed the (Presidential power of) command of the [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian Armed Forces]]. Early March 2014 [[Vladimir Putin]], President of the [[Russia]]n Federation, stated he did not regard Turchynov as the legitimate Ukrainian President.{{cite news|author=Dave Boyer|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2014/mar/4/kerry-lands-ukraine-promise-1-billion-us-aid/|title=Obama tells Putin stop "meddling" in Ukraine and withdraw troops from Crimea|newspaper=[[The Washington Times]]|date=4 March 2014|accessdate=5 March 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140304183810/http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2014/mar/4/kerry-lands-ukraine-promise-1-billion-us-aid/|archivedate=4 March 2014|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}} On 14 April 2014, while talking on the phone with Secretary-General [[Ban Ki Moon]], Turchynov asked for the [[United Nations]]'s support regarding [[2014 pro-Russian conflict in Ukraine|the crisis in eastern Ukraine]], to which the Secretary-General replied that [[peacekeeping|peacekeepers]] may be sent in should Russia withhold its veto. Meanwhile, Turchynov issued a deadline to the pro-Russian insurgents to disarm and dismantle their barricades, but the deadline passed without incident.{{cite news|title=Ukraine asks for UN peacekeepers as pro-Russia militants flout deadline|date=14 April 2014|accessdate=15 April 2014|newspaper=[[Windsor Star]]|url=http://www.windsorstar.com/news/Acting+Ukraine+President+Oleksandr+Turchynov+asks+peacekeepers/9736337/story.html|archivedate=15 April 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140415032317/http://www.windsorstar.com/news/Acting+Ukraine+President+Oleksandr+Turchynov+asks+peacekeepers/9736337/story.html|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} Before he issued a deadline, which was scheduled for 9 am,{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/reuters/2014/04/14/world/europe/14reuters-ukraine-crisis.html?ref=world|title=Separatists Ignore Ultimatum, Tighten Grip on East Ukraine|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=14 April 2014|accessdate=15 April 2014|archivedate=31 October 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171031091215/https://www.nytimes.com/reuters/2014/04/14/world/europe/14reuters-ukraine-crisis.html?ref=world|deadurl=no}} he tried to negotiate with insurgents and even proposed to hold referendum on the same day as elections which will be on 25 May. His proposition was questioned by journalists who feared that the referendum might be sabotaged by pro-Russia insurgents.{{cite news|newspaper=[[Tehran Times]]|url=http://tehrantimes.com/world/115109-separatist-unrest-spreads-in-ukraine-no-sign-of-military-crackdown|title=Separatist unrest spreads in Ukraine, no sign of military crackdown|date=14 April 2014|accessdate=15 April 2014|archivedate=15 April 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140415171547/http://tehrantimes.com/world/115109-separatist-unrest-spreads-in-ukraine-no-sign-of-military-crackdown|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}} On 20 April 2014, Turchinov covertly ordered [[Dmytro Yarosh]] to lead 20 [[Right Sector]] members to sabotage a separatist-controlled television tower, leading to the first combat fatalities of the [[Siege of Sloviansk]], according to an interview given by Dmytro Yarosh on 22 April 2016.[http://censor.net.ua/resonance/385673/dmitro_yarosh_pershiyi_nastupalniyi_byi_vyini_vdbuvsya_20_kvtnya_2014go_dobrovolts_atakuvali_blokpost ДМИТРО ЯРОШ: "ПЕРШИЙ НАСТУПАЛЬНИЙ БІЙ ВІЙНИ ВІДБУВСЯ 20 КВІТНЯ 2014-ГО - ДОБРОВОЛЬЦІ АТАКУВАЛИ БЛОКПОСТ ПІД СЛОВ'ЯНСЬКОМ"]. Censor.net.ua. 2016-04-22.[https://deutsch.rt.com/europa/38160-ehemaliger-befehlshaber-rechten-sektors-gibt/ Ehemaliger Befehlshaber des "Rechten Sektors" gibt zu, Krieg im Donbass provoziert zu haben]. ''RT Deutsch''. 2016-05-05 ([http://www.fort-russ.com/2016/05/yarosh-takes-credit-for-starting-war-in.html English translation]) [[Petro Poroshenko]] was [[Ukrainian presidential election, 2014|elected President of Ukraine on 25 May 2014]].{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/ukraine-talks-set-to-open-without-pro-russian-separatists/2014/05/14/621dbc6a-c7d9-40bc-b2e5-814a4108bbef_story.html|title=Ukraine talks set to open without pro-Russian separatists|newspaper=''[[The Washington Post]]|date=14 May 2014|accessdate=29 May 2014}}{{cite news|date=22 May 2014|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-27518989|title=Ukraine elections: Runners and risks|work=[[BBC News Online]]|accessdate=29 May 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140527092109/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-27518989|archivedate=27 May 2014|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|date=7 February 2010|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/8460978.stm|title=Q&A: Ukraine presidential election|publisher=[[BBC News]]|accessdate=29 May 2014|archivedate=29 April 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140429045939/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/8460978.stm|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|url=http://www.nrcu.gov.ua/en/148/566632/|title=Poroshenko wins presidential election with 54.7% of vote – CEC|publisher=[[Radio Ukraine International]]|date=29 May 2014|accessdate=29 May 2014|archivedate=29 May 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140529212731/http://www.nrcu.gov.ua/en/148/566632/|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}}
{{cite news|url=http://telegraf.com.ua/ukraina/politika/1300294-rezultatyi-vyiborov-prezidenta-ukrainyi-2014-tsik-obrabotala-51-99.html|script-title=ru:Внеочередные выборы Президента Украины|trans-title=Results election of Ukrainian president|publisher=Телеграф|date=29 May 2014|accessdate=29 May 2014|archivedate=29 May 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140529233925/http://telegraf.com.ua/ukraina/politika/1300294-rezultatyi-vyiborov-prezidenta-ukrainyi-2014-tsik-obrabotala-51-99.html|deadurl=no|language=ru|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]]|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/205114.html|title=New Ukrainian president will be elected for 5-year term – Constitutional Court|date=16 May 2014|accessdate=29 May 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140517121006/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/205114.html|archivedate=17 May 2014|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}} Poroshenko was sworn in as Ukrainian President on 7 June 2014, this ended the presidential powers of Turchynov.{{cite news |url=https://online.wsj.com/article/BT-CO-20140529-707812.html |title=Petro Poroshenko to Be Inaugurated as Ukraine President June 7 |author=Lukas Alpert |newspaper=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |date=29 May 2014 |accessdate=29 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140529234158/http://online.wsj.com/article/BT-CO-20140529-707812.html |archivedate=29 May 2014 }}
{{cite news |agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]] |url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/207670.html |title=Rada decides to hold inauguration of Poroshenko on June 7 at 1000 |date=3 June 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140603165249/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/207670.html |archivedate=3 June 2014 |df=dmy-all }}
{{cite news |agency=Interfax-Ukraine |date=7 June 2014 |url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/208367.html |title=Poroshenko sworn in as Ukrainian president |archivedate=1 July 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140701184604/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/208367.html |df=dmy-all }} On 10 September 2014, Turchynov became founding member the new party [[People's Front (Ukraine)|People's Front]].{{cite news|url=http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/09/10/7037335/|script-title=uk:Яценюк очолив політраду "Народного фронту", Турчинов - голова штабу|trans-title=Yatsenyuk became a leader of the "People's Front" political council, while Turchynov is a head of its headquarters|newspaper=[[Ukrayinska Pravda]]|date=10 September 2014|accessdate=10 September 2014|archivedate=11 September 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140911002615/http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/09/10/7037335/|language=uk|df=dmy-all}}
{{cite news|url=http://en.ria.ru/world/20140910/192809518/Ukrainian-PM-Parliament-Speaker-to-Head-Newly-Formed-Popular.html|title=Ukrainian PM, Parliament Speaker to Head Newly Formed Popular Front Party|agency=[[RIA Novosti]]|date=10 September 2014|accessdate=10 September 2014|archivedate=11 September 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140911002115/http://en.ria.ru/world/20140910/192809518/Ukrainian-PM-Parliament-Speaker-to-Head-Newly-Formed-Popular.html|df=dmy-all}} In an interview with the [[BBC]], Turchynov admitted that in 2014, when the first volunteers went to war, he was personally giving them weapons, but not all were clean in the eyes of the law: "And I personally signed the orders for the weapons, many were worried about what would happen if they did not follow those orders with a weapons. Indeed, we didn't check anyone at that time, if they were convicted previously or not – whoever said that they are ready to defend the country, signed up, received weapons and went to the East of our country."{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.com/russian/features-39567526|title=Александр Турчинов: "Наша задача — продвигаться на восток"|publisher=[[BBC]]|author=Svyatoslav Khomenko, Vyacheslav Shramovich|date=14 April 2017|accessdate=22 June 2018|language=ru}}{{cite web|url=https://www.segodnya.ua/ukraine/turchinov-rasskazal-kak-v-nachale-voyny-vooruzhal-ugolovnikov-1012898.html|title=Турчинов рассказал, как в начале войны вооружал уголовников|publisher=''[[Segodnya]]''|date=14 April 2017|accessdate=22 June 2018|language=ru}}{{cite web|url=http://fakty.ictv.ua/ru/ukraine/20170414-turchynov-ya-vidkryvav-sklady-zi-zbroyeyu-bo-ofitsery-vidmovylysya/|title=Турчинов об АТО: Я открывал склады с оружием, потому что офицеры отказались|publisher=[[ICTV (Ukraine)|ICTV]]|date=14 April 2017|accessdate=22 June 2018|language=ru}} On 21 September 2014, he said that Russia doesn't admits that their soldiers are fighting in Ukraine. He also stated that Russia is the main aggressor and that during the conflict his nation have lost over 1,000 lives with 100s missing. During the same [[Facebook]] message he compared the conflict to the butterflies, a metaphor to one of [[Ray Bradbury]]'s works.{{cite news|newspaper=[[Segodnya]]|date=21 September 2014|url=http://www.segodnya.ua/regions/donetsk/turchinov-rossiya-cinichno-ne-priznaet-pered-svoim-narodom-chto-ih-soldaty-voyuyut-v-ukraine-553947.html|title=Турчинов: Россия цинично не признает перед своим народом, что их солдаты воюют в Украине|trans-title=Turchynov: Russia cynically doesn't admit in front of its people, that their soldiers are fighting in Ukraine|accessdate=26 September 2014}} Turchynov was elected his party's faction leader on 27 November 2014.{{uk icon}} [http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/11/27/7045600/ In Parliament created a faction], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (27 November 2014) On 16 December 2014, President Poroshenko appointed Turchynov as Secretary of the [[National Security and Defence Council of Ukraine]].[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/240095.html Turchynov becomes secretary of Ukraine's NSDC], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (16 December 2014)[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/240057.html President Poroshenko decides to appoint Turchynov Ukraine's NSDC secretary – source], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (16 December 2014) According to the social poll of the "Sofia" centre, in June 2017, only 0.9% of respondents said that they completely trust Turchynov, 9.5% trust him, 24.1% do not trust him, 57.4% do not trust him at all.{{cite web|url=https://strana.ua/news/74794-82-ukraincev-ne-doveryayut-avakovu.html|publisher=Strana.ua|date=7 June 2017|title=Турчинову и Авакову не доверяют 82% украинцев, а Яценюку - более 90%|trans-title=Turchynov and Avakov are not trusted by 82% of Ukrainians, and Yatsenyuk - more than 90%|accessdate=20 September 2018|language=ru}}{{cite web|url=https://ukranews.com/news/501390-sekretaryu-snbo-turchynovu-doveryaet-vsego-1-ukrayncev|publisher=[[Ukrainian News Agency]]|date=7 June 2017|title=Секретарю СНБО Турчинову доверяет всего 1% украинцев|trans-title=Only 1% of Ukrainians trust to Secretary of the NSDC Turchynov |accessdate=20 September 2018|language=ru}} ==Business activity== On 10 September 2014, Oleksandr Turchynov published a letter in which he urged retailers to take a closer look at the products of ''Tarasove Dzherelo'', a small producer of [[mineral water]]. He proposed to conclude deals with that company. Some market experts assessed the actions of Turchinov as [[Lobbying|lobbyism]].{{cite web | url = http://forbes.net.ua/business/1380190-marketing-agentstvo-rada-kak-aleksandr-turchinov-prodvigaet-chastnogo-proizvoditelya-vody | title = Маркетинг-агентство «Рада»: как Александр Турчинов продвигает частного производителя воды | publisher = ''[[Forbes]]'' | author = Bohdan Khlymonenko | date = 3 October 2014 | accessdate = 9 August 2018 | language = ru}} According to the [[Investigative journalism|journalistic investigation]], Turchinov's [[mother-in-law]], Tamara Beliba, owns the largest data center in the [[Baltic states]] — ''MC-office''. Beliba owns the ''Ekonomikos Institutas'' company, which owns a data center located in [[Kaunas]], [[Lithuania]]. The total volume of investments was $200 million.{{cite web | url = https://www.kp.ru/daily/26224.3/3106684/ | title = Украиной рулят девять уголовников и клиент психбольницы | publisher = ''[[Komsomolskaya Pravda]]'' | date = 24 April 2014 | accessdate = 4 April 2018 | language = ru}}{{cite web | url = https://ukranews.com/news/495426-teshha-turchynova-stroyt-ogromnyy-data-centr-v-lytve | title = Теща Турчинова строит огромный дата-центр в Литве | publisher = ''[[Ukrainian News Agency]]'' | date = 4 May 2017 | accessdate = 4 April 2018 | language = ru}}{{cite web | url = https://bihus.info/tesa-turcinova-povazala-golovu-rnbo-z-veliceznim-data-centrom-u-litvi | title = Теща Турчинова пов'язала голову РНБО з величезним дата-центром у Литві | publisher = bihus.info | author = Maxim Opanasenko | date = 4 May 2017 | accessdate = 4 April 2018 | language = uk}} Tamara Beliba is also the owner of the company "Ekostilkom", which in turn owns a house near Kiev with a size of 1,000 m² with a plot of land of 0.5 hectares. Turchynov's mother-in-law is the owner of warehouses with a total area of 6,000 m² in Kiev on the Akademika Koroleva Prospect. Another company of Tamara Beliba owns three facilities with the size of more than 200 m² each in the centre of Kiev on Konovalets street.{{cite web | url = https://nv.ua/ukr/ukraine/politics/zapisanij-na-teshchu-budinok-v-tisjachu-kvadrativ-i-restoran-u-testja-zhurnalisti-rozpovili-pro-neruhomosti-sim-ji-turchinova-463071.html | title = Записаний на тещу будинок в тисячу квадратів і ресторан у тестя. Журналісти знайшли нові маєтки сім'ї Турчинова | publisher = nv.ua | date = 12 January 2017 | accessdate = 13 August 2018 | language = uk}}{{cite web | url = https://hromadske.ua/posts/oleksandr-turchinov-maetki-rodini | title = «Свята земля»: Як родина Олександра Турчинова обросла маєтками і ділянками | publisher = ''[[Hromadske.TV]]'' | date = 12 January 2017 | accessdate = 13 August 2018 | language = uk}} According to the ''United State Register of Legal Entities, Individual Entrepreneurs and Public Organizations'' of Ukraine, the entire business in the Turchynov family is executed on his mother-in-law Tamara Beliba, mother Valentina and wife Anna. The family is engaged in economic research, film production, providing communication services and building data centres. This business is related with economic research, [[Filmmaking|film production]], the provision of [[telecommunications service]]s and [[data center]]s.{{cite web | url = https://ru.tsn.ua/politika/biznesom-v-seme-turchinova-rukovodit-ego-tescha-351448.html | title = Бизнесом в семье Турчинова руководит его теща | publisher = ''TSN'' / ''[[1+1 (TV channel)|1+1]]'' | date = 25 February 2014 | accessdate = 8 October 2018 | language = ru}}{{cite web | url = https://whoswhos.org/12057-turchinov-aleksandr-valentinovich-dose-38-23/ | title = Турчинов Александр Валентинович | publisher = whoswhos.org | date = 18 July 2014 | accessdate = 8 October 2018 | language = ru}} On 1 May 2017, the journalistic investigation of the program ''Our money with Denis Bigus'' (channel ''24'') proved the connection between Oleksandr Turchynov and people's deputy Ruslan Lukyanchuk with three large companies (''Absolut Finance'', ''Magnate'' and ''Octave Finance'') that own 1,200 exchange points of 3,500 legal [[Bureau de change|currency exchange offices]] in Ukraine. These points exchanged currencies without [[cash register]]s, which violates the requirements of the law, since in this case automatic tax reporting is not provided to the [[State Fiscal Service (Ukraine)|State Fiscal Service]]. All these companies are listed on the nominees — Oksana and Ilona Brodovskaya and Hryhoriy Pron'ko (Oksana's father). However, their connection with the joint business of Turchinov and Lukyanchuk was proved by journalists — Oksana and her husband Valentin Brodovsky were assistants of Ruslan Lukyanchuk during four convocations of the Verkhovna Rada.{{cite web| url = http://24tv.ua/komu_nalezhat_punkti_obminu_valyut_i_chomu_podatkova_ne_bachit_podatkiv_nardepa_n812815 | title = Кому належать пункти обміну валют і чому податкова "не бачить" податків нардепа | publisher = TV-channel 24 | language = uk | date = 1 May 2017 | accessdate = 27 April 2018}}{{cite web| url = https://ru.tsn.ua/politika/smi-svyazali-s-turchinovym-i-lukyanchukom-obmenniki-sovladelicey-kotoryh-yavlyaetsya-23-letnyaya-model-852620.html | title = СМИ связали с Турчиновым и Лукьянчуком обменники, совладелицей которых является 23-летняя модель | publisher = ''TSN'' | language = ru | date = 3 May 2017 | accessdate = 27 April 2018}}{{cite web| url = http://korrespondent.net/ukraine/3847337-obmennye-punkty-turchynova-yzbehauit-nalohovoi-smy | title = Обменные пункты Турчинова избегают налоговой — СМИ | publisher = Корреспондент.net | language = ru | date = 4 May 2017 | accessdate = 27 April 2018}} Investigations on this subject were published in the Ukrainian media earlier.{{cite web| url = https://strana.ua/articles/analysis/24464-kak-okruzhenie-turchinova-monopolizirovalo-rynok-obmena-valyut.html | title = Какое отношение имеет Турчинов к обменным пунктам в Украине | publisher = «[[Страна.ua]]» | language = ru | date = 27 July 2016 | accessdate = 27 April 2018}} Oleksandr Turchynov's father-in-law Vladimir Beliba together with businessman Ihor Tynnyy opened in 2013 in the center of Kiev a restaurant of [[Italian cuisine]] "Montecchi v Capuleti". This was reported in May 2016 by the journalists of ''Nashi hroshi'' project.{{cite web| url = https://gordonua.com/news/money/nash-grosh-test-turchinova-otkryl-italyanskiy-restoran-v-centre-kieva-131872.html | title = «Наші гроші»: Тесть Турчинова открыл итальянский ресторан в центре Киева | publisher = gordonua.com | language = ru | date = 11 May 2016 | accessdate = 5 November 2018}}{{cite web| url = http://nashigroshi.org/2016/05/10/pislya-evromajdanu-test-turchynova-vidkryv-italijskyj-restoran-z-tynnym/ | title = Після Євромайдану тесть Турчинова відкрив італійський ресторан з Тинним | publisher = nashigroshi.org | language = uk | date = 10 May 2016 | accessdate = 5 November 2018}}{{cite web| url = https://business.vesti-ukr.com/147787-u-testja-turchinova-nashli-romeo-restoran-v-centre-kieva | title = У тестя Турчинова нашли ромео-ресторан в центре Киева | publisher = vesti-ukr.com | language = ru | date = 10 May 2016 | accessdate = 5 November 2018}}{{cite web| url = https://www.epravda.com.ua/news/2016/05/10/592110/ | title = Тесть Турчинова володіє рестораном в центрі Києва - ЗМІ | publisher = ''[[Ukrayinska Pravda]]'' | language = uk | date = 10 May 2016 | accessdate = 5 November 2018}} According to media reports, Turchynov is involved in establishment of the following companies: "Institute for Economic Reforms" LLC,{{cite web| url = http://zakon.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/v0019359-97 | title = Про реєстрацію списку кандидатів у народні депутати України від політичної партії Всеукраїнське об'єднання "Громада" в багатомандатному загальнодержавному виборчому окрузі по виборах народних депутатів України 29 березня 1998 року | publisher = [[Verkhovna Rada]] | language = uk | date = 29 March 1998 | accessdate = 1 November 2018}} "Information Technologies of the 21st Century" CJSC, "Pharmacor" LLC, "ZET" LLC, "Europe-X" LLC, "Editorial board of Vecherniye Vesti newspaper" LLC, "VV" LLC, "SVV" LLC, "Janus" Real Estate Agency LLC.{{cite web| url = http://2005.novayagazeta.ru/nomer/2005/16n/n16n-s08.shtml | title = И вот она нарядная… | publisher = ''[[Novaya Gazeta]]'' | author = Aleksandra Gordiyenko | language = ru | date = 3 March 2005 | accessdate = 1 November 2018}}{{cite web| url = https://lenta.ru/lib/14160432/#63 | title = Турчинов, Александр | publisher = ''[[Lenta.ru]]'' | author = | language = ru | date = 2012 | accessdate = 16 November 2018}}{{cite web| url = http://polittech.org/2012/09/21/aleksandra-turchinova/ | title = Александр Турчинов | publisher = polittech.org | author = | language = ru | date = 2012-09-21 | accessdate = 1 November 2018}} ==Controversies== In June 2003, the Deputy Prosecutor General of Ukraine [[Viktor Shokin]] announced his intention to send the proposal to the [[Verkhovna Rada|Ukrainian Parliament]] an idea to bringing to trial the deputies Alexander Turchinov, Stepan Khmara and Nikolai Rudkovsky. According to Shokin, the People's deputies were insulting and beating the staff of the [[Lukyanivska Prison]]. Deputies demanded the release of Gennady Tymoshenko and Antonina Bolyura. They were incriminated with three cases of the [[Law of Ukraine#Criminal law|Criminal code]]: "Capturing state buildings", "Threat to law enforcement officers", and "Excess of power with the use of weapons and verbal insulting of law enforcement officers."{{cite web| url = http://podrobnosti.ua/65670-genprokuratura-planiruet-privlech-k-ugolovnoj-otvetstvennosti-deputatov-shturmovavshih-sizo.html | title = Генпрокуратура планирует привлечь к уголовной ответственности депутатов, штурмовавших СИЗО | publisher = podrobnosti.ua | language = ru | date = 27 July 2003 | accessdate = 2 April 2018}}{{cite web| url = http://korrespondent.net/ukraine/politics/73958-genprokuratura-hochet-privlech-k-otvetstvennosti-treh-deputatov-verhovnoj-rady-obnovleno | title = Генпрокуратура хочет привлечь к ответственности трех депутатов Верховной Рады (обновлено) | publisher = Korrespondent.net | language = ru | date = 27 July 2003 | accessdate = 2 April 2018}}{{cite web| url = https://www.pravda.com.ua/rus/news/2003/06/27/4373311/ | title = Турчинов, Хмара, Рудьковский — криминальные хулиганы? | publisher = ''[[Ukrayinska Pravda]]'' | language = ru | date = 27 July 2003 | accessdate = 2 April 2018}} On September 13, 2003, tax officials detained at the office of the "Fatherland" party Ruslan Lukyanchuk, one of the assistants of Oleksandr Turchynov. He was charged with involvement in [[Foreign exchange fraud|illegal currency exchange]]. The [[Prosecutor General of Ukraine]] Svyatoslav Piskun then stated that the detention of Turchynov's assistant was part of a planned process of initiating a criminal case. According to Piskun, about hundreds of thousands of illegally converted dollars were sent to the office of the "Fatherland" party.{{cite web | url = http://podrobnosti.ua/37925-vozbuzhdeno-ugolovnoe-delo-protiv-turchinova.html | title = Возбуждено уголовное дело против Турчинова | publisher = podrobnosti.ua | date = 2 October 2002 | accessdate = 27 March 2018 | language = ru}} In February 2006 state prosecutors opened a criminal case against Turchynov and his SBU deputy Andriy Kozhemyakin for destroying a file about [[FBI Ten Most Wanted Fugitive]], organized crime boss [[Semyon Mogilevich]], from the SBU archive. The case was dismissed four months later.{{cite news|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/nation/detail/92521/|first=Peter|last=Byrne|title=New and conflicting details emerge over Mogilevich's alleged involvement in nation|newspaper=[[Kyiv Post]]|date=10 December 2010|accessdate=15 December 2010|archivedate=14 December 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101214053146/http://www.kyivpost.com/news/nation/detail/92521/|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}} [[WikiLeaks]] documents mention Turchynov, then head of Ukraine's SBU, as having destroyed documents implicating [[Yulia Tymoshenko]]'s alleged connections to [[Semion Mogilevich|Mogilevich]].{{cite news|date=10 December 2010|accessdate=23 February 2014|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/new-and-conflicting-details-emerge-over-mogilevich-92521.html|author=Peter Byrne|title=New and conflicting details emerge over Mogilevich's alleged involvement in nation|newspaper=Kyiv Post|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121003052951/http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/new-and-conflicting-details-emerge-over-mogilevich-92521.html|archivedate=3 October 2012|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}} According to the ''[[Komsomolskaya Pravda in Ukraine]]'' newspaper referring to deputy mayor of [[Kiev]] [[Leonid Chernovetskyi]], Mr. Turchynov is related to unlawful construction in the Landscape Valley (''Peyzazhna aleya'') district of [[Kiev]]. In autumn of 2004 the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine]] signed an investment contract with JSC ''Ukrainian Property'' (OAO "Ukrayinsʹke mayno") on the construction of an apartment building in this district. With this the share of the MFA in the project made just 20%. The Ministry actually became a cover for the businessmen. As of the 1 January 2007, 91.1% of the JSC ''Ukrainian Property'' shares belonged to ''Eclad Invest Ltd.'' (USA), and 8.2% to Valery Kovalenko. Previously, the shares of JSC ''Ukrainian Property'' belonged to JSC ''Financial holding "L-Holding"'', the largest shareholder of which was JSC ''Centre of Financial Technologies''. Oleksandr Turchinov owned 26.2% of the shares of this company.{{cite web | url = https://from-ua.com/news/131567-smi-turchinov-prichasten-k-nezakonnoi-zastroike-na-peizazhnoi-allee.html | title = СМИ: Турчинов причастен к незаконной застройке на Пейзажной аллее | publisher = from-ua.com | date = 7 May 2008 | accessdate = 19 March 2018 | language = ru}}{{cite web | url = https://www.segodnya.ua/newsarchive/ctrojku-na-pejzazhnoj-allee-initsiiroval-turchinov---kilchitskaja.html | title = Стройку на Пейзажной аллее инициировал Турчинов – Кильчицкая | publisher = ''[[Segodnya]]'' | date = 17 April 2008 | accessdate = 19 March 2018 | language = ru}} On April 23, 2008, the Kiev District Administrative Court ruled that Oleksandr Turchinov had no personal relationship with the construction of the Landscape Valley.{{cite web | url = https://www.unian.net/politics/111971-sud-ustanovil-chto-turchinov-na-peyzajnoy-allee-nichego-ne-stroit.html | title = Суд установил, что Турчинов на Пейзажной аллее ничего не строит | publisher = [[Ukrainian Independent Information Agency|UNIAN]] | date = 23 April 2008 | accessdate = 19 March 2018 | language = ru}} In 2005, Oleksandr Turchinov ordered to organize an illegal wiretapping of the journalist of ''[[Segodnya]]'' newspaper Oleksandr Korchinsky. This fact was made public at a press conference by [[Viktor Shokin]], former Prosecutor General of Ukraine. The telephone of the journalist was tapped from June 25 to July 12, 2005. Turchinov personally took this decision. The journalist's phone was [[Covert listening device|bugged]] without sanctions of the court.{{cite web | url = https://www.unian.net/world/3204-turchinov-schitaet-svoe-ugolovnoe-delo-politicheski-zakazannyim.html | title = Турчинов считает свое уголовное дело политически заказанным | publisher = [[Ukrainian Independent Information Agency|UNIAN]] | date = 23 April 2006 | accessdate = 16 March 2018 | language = ru}}{{cite web | url = http://fakty.ua/44875-sbu-slushala-zhurnalista-quot-segodnya-quot-po-sankcii-suda---vnesya-na-nego-predstavlenie-kak-na-sotrudnika-pravoohranitelnyh-organov | title = Сбу слушала журналиста "сегодня" по санкции суда — внеся на него представление как на сотрудника правоохранительных органов | publisher = fakty.ua | author = Irina Rybinskaya | date = 25 March 2006 | accessdate = 16 March 2018 | language = ru}}{{cite web | url = https://korrespondent.net/ukraine/politics/155563-byut-hochet-pomenyat-genprokuraturu | title = БЮТ хочет поменять Генпрокуратуру | publisher = korrespondent.net | date = 5 June 2006 | accessdate = 16 March 2018 | language = ru}} On 14 March 2006, the Prosecutor General's Office of Ukraine have opened a criminal case on the fact of illegal wiretapping of senior officials. Most of these wiretapping took place in 2005, when Oleksandr Turchynov was the head of SSU.{{cite web | url = https://rg.ru/2006/03/14/ukraina.html | title = На Украине подслушали послов | publisher = ''[[Rossiyskaya Gazeta]]'' | author = Ivanna Gorina | date = 16 March 2006 | accessdate = 30 March 2018 | language = ru}}{{cite web | url = http://fakty.ua/44544-oleg-rybachuk-quot-k-sozhaleniyu-uzhe-posle-pobedy-quot-oranzhevoj-quot-vlasti-byli-fakty-proslushivaniya-vysshih-dolzhnostnyh-lic-gosudarstva-quot | title = Олег Рыбачук: "К сожалению, уже после победы "оранжевой" власти были факты прослушивания высших должностных лиц государства" | publisher = fakty.ua | date = 14 March 2006 | accessdate = 30 March 2018 | language = ru}} In August 2016, journalists of the ''Economichna Pravda'' (''[[Ukrayinska Pravda]]'' project) accused Oleksandr Turchinov of influencing the leadership of the [[State Special Communications Service of Ukraine]] (DSTSZI). Despite the introduction of the system of electronic declarations on the incomes of civil servants and officials, those declarations without a DSTSZI's security certificate could not have legal force in court cases. A number of analysts accused Turchinov of disrupting the launch of the e-declaration system.{{cite news|url=https://www.kyivpost.com/article/content/reform-watch/e-declaration-system-doesnt-work-despite-formal-launch-422168.html|author=Alyona Zhuk, Oleg Sukhov|title=E-declaration system doesn't work despite formal launch|publisher=''[[Kyiv Post]]''|date=2 December 2016|accessdate=18 April 2018|language=en}}{{cite news|url=http://uacrisis.org/46093-e-declaration|title=Failure to launch E-system for asset declaration fully – what threats are there for Ukraine?|publisher=UCMC|date=15 August 2016|accessdate=18 April 2018|language=en}}{{cite news|url=https://www.eurointegration.com.ua/articles/2016/08/14/7053339/|title=Хто зірвав електронне декларування статків: хронологія та документи|publisher=eurointegration.com.ua|author=Serhiy Sydorenko|date=14 August 2016|accessdate=18 April 2018|language=uk}}{{cite news|url=https://strana.ua/news/27408-smi-obvinili-turchinova-i-yacenyuka-v-sryve-e-deklarirovaniya.html|title=За срывом запуска е-декларирования может стоять Турчинов — СМИ|publisher=''[[Segodnya]]''|date=15 August 2016|accessdate=18 April 2018|language=ru}} On 15 August 2016, [[Serhiy Kaplin]], Secretary of the Committee for National Security and Defense of the Verkhovna Rada, published an open appeal to the National Anti-Corruption Bureau of Ukraine and the [[Prosecutor General of Ukraine|Prosecutor General]] demanding to confirm the attitude of Oleksandr Turchinov to private [[Arms industry|arms manufacturers]]. Turchinov actively lobbies the entry of these manufacturers to the market.{{cite web| url = https://kp.ua/politics/548067-deputat-antykorruptsyonnoe-buiro-y-hpu-dolzhny-proveryt-rabotu-turchynova | publisher = ''RBC-Ukraine'' | language = ru | date = 15 August 2016 | accessdate = 28 April 2018}} Kaplin also demands the Prosecutor General to open cases against Turchynov and [[Serhiy Pashynskyi]] Korrespondent.net | language = ru | date = 2 August 2016 | accessdate = 1 June 2018}} In March 2017, former people's deputy [[Oleksandr Shepelev]] accused Turchinov and [[Ruslan Lukyanchuk]] of There, hryvnias were converted into the [[cash]] dollars, which then were withdrawn to [[Offshore financial centre|offshores]] through the Baltic banks and [[Shell corporation|shell companies]]. The largest of these companies was ''Fortex'', owned by Lukyanchuk and registered in the [[United Kingdom|UK]]. ==Earnings== According to the electronic declaration, in 2016, Oleksandr Turchinov received 512,807 [[Ukrainian hryvnia|hryvnias]] (US$19,618) as salary in the Verkhovna Rada. He received interest of 1.7 million hryvnias (US$65,034) from bank [[Deposit account|deposits]]. Another 22.8 thousand hryvnias formed an income from the alienation of securities and [[Corporate personhood|corporate rights]]. On bank accounts, Turchinov had 49.8 thousand hryvnias, US$810.4 thousand, and about [[Euro|€]] 10 thousand. He also declared US$735 thousand, €55 thousand, and 320 thousand hryvnias in cash. Additionally, Turchinov had a collection of ancient [[Bible]]s, 12 paintings, as well as [[copyright]]s to books and films. His spouse has declared 447.5 thousand grivnas of income.{{cite web | url = https://rian.com.ua/politics/20170402/1022813677.html | title = Турчинов заработал в 2016 году почти 2,2 млн грн — декларация | publisher = ''[[RIA Novosti]] Ukraine'' | language = ru | date = 2 April 2017 | accessdate = 17 April 2018}}{{cite web | url = http://www.pravda.com.ua/rus/news/2017/03/31/7139869/ | title = Турчинов оставил $735 тысяч наличными и задекларировал 2,2 млн грн доходов | publisher = ''[[Ukrayinska Pravda]]'' | language = ru | date = 31 March 2017 | accessdate = 17 April 2018}}{{cite web | url = https://112.ua/politika/turchinov-zadeklariroval-bolee-2-mln-grn-za-proshlyy-god-381490.html | title = Турчинов задекларировал более 2 млн грн за прошлый год | publisher = [[112 Ukraine]] | language = ru | date = 31 March 2017 | accessdate = 17 April 2018}}{{cite web| url = https://public.nazk.gov.ua/declaration/c6a80388-f7d8-4428-9fc4-adc57721ce74 | title = Перегляд декларації | publisher = Unified State Register of Declarations | language = uk | date = 30 March 2017 | accessdate = 17 April 2018}} ==Awards== On 31 October 2014, at the ceremony of rewarding the participants of the [[War in Donbass|special operation in Donbass]], the head of the [[Ministry of Internal Affairs (Ukraine)|Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine]] [[Arsen Avakov]] awarded Oleksandr Turchinov a compact self-loading [[PSM pistol|pistol PSM-05]] for services to the ministry. The Minister expressed the hope that he will assist the Ministry in the future.{{cite web| url = https://www.rbc.ru/rbcfreenews/54538127cbb20f1075ea4fb8 | title = Аваков наградил Турчинова карабином за заслуги перед МВД | publisher = ''[[RBK Group|RBK]]'' | language = ru | date = 31 October 2014 | accessdate = 14 May 2018}} Turchinov also has three more award weapons - a revolver of ''[[Series ALFA (Revolvers)|Alfa 3541]]'' caliber [[.357 Magnum]] (30 April 2014), a pistol machine gun ''[[RPC Fort|Fort-226]]'' (30 March 2015), and a semi-automatic pistol ''[[Mauser C96]]'' with 105 bullets.{{cite web| url = http://korrespondent.net/ukraine/3633381-yatsenuiku-podaryly-hanhsterskyi-avtomat | title = Яценюку подарили "гангстерский" автомат | publisher = korrespondent.net | date = 23 February 2016 | accessdate = 14 May 2018 | language = ru}} In May 2016, Minister of Internal Affairs of Ukraine [[Arsen Avakov]] confirmed that Turchinov was awarded the Maxim's machine gun model 1910 ([[PM M1910]]).{{cite web| url = https://sharij.net/55448 | title = Аваков подтвердил, что Турчинова наградили пулеметом "Максим" | publisher = sharij.net | date = 30 May 2016 | accessdate = 15 June 2018 | language = ru}}{{cite web| url = https://www.segodnya.ua/politics/avakov-priznalsya-chto-vydal-pulemet-ne-tolko-yacenyuku-720071.html | title = Аваков признался, что выдал пулемет не только Яценюку | publisher = ''[[Segodnya]]'' | date = 30 May 2016 | accessdate = 15 June 2018 | language = ru}} On 2 May 2018, by the decree of the President of Ukraine, he was awarded the [[Order of Prince Yaroslav the Wise]] of the Fifth Class.{{cite web| url = http://www.president.gov.ua/documents/1172018-24094 | title = Указ Президента України від 2 травня 2018 року № 117/2018 «Про відзначення державними нагородами України» | publisher = The Presidential Administration of Ukraine | date = 2 May 2018 | accessdate = 14 May 2018 | language = uk}} ==Personal life== His wife is Hanna Turchynova (born 1970), PhD, dean of the faculty of natural geography and ecology at [[National Pedagogical Dragomanov University]].{{uk icon}} [https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2018/06/20/7183976/ Human rights activists demand the release of Turchinov's wife because of homophobia], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (20 June 2018) They have one son, Kyrylo (born 1994), a student that finished his [[master's degree]] [[thesis]] in 2014.{{cite news|language=uk|url=http://tabloid.pravda.com.ua/focus/53d0ceed133b8/|title=Son Turchynov has ascended to the draft|publisher=[[Tablo ID]]|date=24 July 2014|accessdate=25 July 2014}} Turchynov is known for abstaining from tobacco and alcohol. He is part of the [[Religion in Ukraine|1.9% of Ukraine's population]] that identify as being [[Protestant]]. Although some in the media have reported that he is a pastor,{{cite news|deadurl=no|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-26316268|title=Profile: Olexander Turchynov|publisher=[[BBC News]]|date=23 February 2014|accessdate=1 March 2014|archivedate=26 February 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140226151510/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-26316268|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|author=Antonia Blumberg|url= http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/02/25/oleksandr-turchynov-baptist_n_4854555.html|title=Oleksandr Turchynov, Baptist Pastor, Named As Ukraine's Acting President|newspaper=[[The Huffington Post]]|date=25 February 2014|accessdate=1 March 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.christianitytoday.com/gleanings/2014/february/ukraine-names-baptist-pastor-as-acting-president.html|title=Ukraine Names Baptist Pastor as Acting President|publisher=[[Christianity Today]]|accessdate=1 March 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140415025136/http://www.christianitytoday.com/gleanings/2014/february/ukraine-names-baptist-pastor-as-acting-president.html|archivedate=15 April 2014|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}} the [[Associated Baptist Press]] and the [[European Baptist Federation]] report{{cite news|url=http://www.abpnews.com/culture/politics/item/28398-ukrainian-leader-puts-spotlight-on-baptists#.Uw_UgF77GZY|title=Elevation of Ukrainian leader puts spotlight on Baptists|agency=[[ABP News]]|accessdate=1 March 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140306115907/http://www.abpnews.com/culture/politics/item/28398-ukrainian-leader-puts-spotlight-on-baptists#.Uw_UgF77GZY|archivedate=6 March 2014|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|accessdate=1 March 2014|url=http://www.ebf.org/baptists-helping-to-serve-new-ukraine|title=European Baptist Federation|publisher=[[European Baptist Federation|EBF]]|archivedate=25 May 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140525193648/http://www.ebf.org/baptists-helping-to-serve-new-ukraine|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}} that he is an [[Elder (Christianity)|elder]] and occasional [[laity|lay]] [[preacher]] at his Kiev church, the Word of Life Center, which is a member of the [[Evangelical Baptist Union of Ukraine]]. In social networks he received the nickname "Bloody Pastor". He treats with irony to this nickname: "I think this nickname is much better than what the Ukrainians gave to [[Vladimir Putin|Putin]]".{{cite web | url = http://news.liga.net/video/politics/4450004-krovavyy_pastor_turchinov_prokommentiroval_svoe_prozvishche_video.htm | title = "Кровавый пастор" Турчинов прокомментировал своё прозвище: видео | publisher = Strana.ua | language = ru | date = 17 December 2014 | accessdate = 3 July 2018}}{{cite web | url = http://www.bbc.com/russian/features-39567526 | title = Александр Турчинов: "Наша задача — продвигаться на восток" | publisher = ''[[BBC]]'' | author = Святослав Хоменко, Вячеслав Шрамович | language = ru | date = 14 April 2017 | accessdate = 3 July 2018}} Also, Turchynov is occasionally considered by some media as the "[[Consigliere]] of Yulia Tymoshenko".{{cite web | url = http://thekievtimes.ua/politics/328365-parlament-predaet-idealy-evromajdana-televedushhij.html | title = Парламент предает идеалы евроМайдана, — телеведущий | publisher = ''[[The Kiev Times]]'' | author = | language = ru | date = 23 February 2014 | accessdate = 16 November 2018}} {{clear}} ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== {{Sister project links|author=yes|wikt=no|v=no|b=no|n=Category:Oleksandr Turchynov|d=Q15850}} {{Library resources box|by=yes|onlinebooks=yes}} *{{Official website|http://turchynov.com/}} {{s-start}} {{s-gov}} {{s-bef|before=[[Ihor Smeshko]]}} {{s-ttl|title=Director of the [[Security Service of Ukraine|Security Service]]|years=2005}} {{s-aft|after=[[Ihor Drizhchany]]}} |- {{s-off}} {{s-bef|before=[[Mykola Azarov]]}} {{s-ttl|title=Deputy Prime Minister of Ukraine|years=2007–2010}} {{s-aft|after=[[Andriy Klyuyev]]}} |- {{s-bef|before=[[Yulia Tymoshenko]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Prime Minister of Ukraine]]
